pros: Friendly People, good pay reliability

job_title: Clinical Support Worker in Birmingham, England
pros: You get the opportunity to help sick children.
cons: Education practitioners offered no support when I spoke of my struggles working on the oncology ward. My request to transfer wards was denied. Nurses working on oncology barely spoke to support staff and remained in their cliques, which made working there even more stressful. Training was inadequate as I was paired with a nurse instead of another support worker, my concerns regarding this were ignored. I had no choice but to leave, and had a job offer elsewhere, but the education practitioner provided a very negative reference, causing my job offer to be retracted and leaving me unemployed for years.

job_title: Clinical Support Worker in Birmingham, England
pros: Inclusive, supportive staff that look after employees
cons: Outdated trust, with technology and still uses paper for many documentations

pros:
It gives me an opportunity to leave home and see different scenes

    I get to practice being with my breath, be calm and be aware at different circumstances

    It makes me appreciate more my time off work and thus use it even more wisely

    It allows me to have a different lunch every day without having to cook

    I get to practice “begin with the end in mind” and “win-win situations” with many different people

    It gives variety to my days

    It gives me opportunities to take pictures

    It helps me to take full responsibility for my own life

    It allows me to wake up on my own and use the first hours of my day to gain clarity and peace and choose what day I want to have

    I get to have interesting conversations with people
cons:
less free time
early mornings
mixing with annoying people you wouldnt choose to mix with if you had the choice

pros:
The patients and their parents can make your day
You really feel as if you're making a difference, however "small" your job
Very rewarding
Was a pleasure working with some of the best surgeons in the whole country
cons:
Management are absolutely terrible, and have no business in their roles.
Too much "office politics", even management are horrible gossip-hounds.

They will happily see you work a 70 hour week, but announce you need to leave a couple hours early because you're unwell and you're a pariah forever.

Warn visitors away if they display flu-like symptoms, but refuse to let staff leave if they have a 40C temperature and are coughing everywhere - one poor co worker had to find a store room and was throwing up in there because on certain shifts you'd have to be dead before you can go. This is what happens with 18 hour shifts.

I worked with at least one horribly racist nurse, she was a DANGER to everyone, believed kids with cancer deserved it, hated white people and black people who were too well-to-do cos it was "too white" for her tastes.

Nobody would sack her because she's black and they're scared of racial backlash.

pros:
- Varied job, no two days were the same  
- Mostly there was always some work to do
- Rewarding; you felt like you made a difference
- Most of the kids/parents were really nice to work with
cons:
- Horrible office politics
- Gossipy management, would listen in on hearsay and tattling and feed it back to you in your review as 'bad feedback'
- I worked with one or two horribly anti-white, anti-medical care nurses. One believed that kids with cancer deserved it due to "being bad in a past life". How she was never sacked when EVERYONE knew about this was beyond me.
- Favoritism in an extreme sense.
- No chances of moving up unless your face fit
- No free time. Expected 18 hour shifts out of you but if you had one day off sick you were looked down on

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: They do not exist for this organisation.
cons: The management is basicly not supportive to staff and they do not do a good job as managers and work with Unison to conspire against staff. One of the worst hospitals I have ever worked for staff is rude and do not even have manners.
